heaviest_rainfall.status: Record-breaking rain fell on 04 January 2025 with a total accumulation of 36.8mm over 37.2 hours and falling at a rate of 4.6mm per hour at times.

heaviest_rainrate.status: 27.0mm per hour is the maximum rain rate ever recorded on 02 September 2025, during a 15.0 hour storm which dumped 21.19mm of rain from the clouds.

longest_rain.status: The lengthiest precipitation event recorded spanned 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025, it was characterized by a peak rain intensity of 4.6mm per hour and a total rainfall of 36.8mm.

most_lightning.status: The most lightning activity recorded in a single day is 23, which occurred on 07 September 2025 (since our records began on 11 April 2025).

storm.status: No stormy weather is anticipated.  The last big storm was recorded on 23 October 2025, lasting 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: At the moment, it is not a cold snap.  This year has seen 6 cold snaps; typically, 3.7 cold snaps happen every year.

extreme.status: The record temperature difference stands at 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C), set on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: Currently, the weather is stable with no heatwaves in progress.  So far, 6 heatwavess have been recorded this year.  The average yearly count is 1.9.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was on 18 July 2025 and it has only happened 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (179°), which differs from the daily average south-westerly (231.0°) by approximately 52.0 degrees.    In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The highest wind gust ever seen is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The record wind run remains at 1737 miles from 21 October 2012.

speed.status: 93.7 mph is the largest wind speed recorded on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the outside temperature (down 2.6°C) and feels like temperature (down 2.2°C) and drier conditions in rainfall (down 0.3 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (up 139 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in light levels (up 3831 lux) and cloud levels (up 499 m) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 139.1m lower than yesterday, 150.6m lower than the past week, 499.4m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels for yesterday ranged from 791m to 1764m and averaged 906.8m, while the past week and month indicated warmer conditions.

summary.summary: Inside; temperature should remain cool. Outside; cold spells are likely. Also, the air will feel dry and little or no wind. A few light raindrops may fall, occasional overcast conditions, and weak sunlight because of clouds. Weather could become unsettled.

washing.phrase: The humidity is too high (86%) for your washing to dry quickly.  Any drying will take longer than usual.
